benchmark_details.name: UStAI (User Stories for AI Systems Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: The UStAI dataset compiles 3000 user stories generated by different Large Language Models (LLMs) from scholarly abstracts related to AI systems, with 1260 evaluated for quality attributes, non-functional requirements, and ethical principles.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a publicly available dataset of user stories generated by LLMs, aiding the requirements elicitation phase of AI systems and facilitating further research in the domain.

data.source: User stories generated using abstracts from 100 scholarly papers covering various domains, curated and annotated for quality and ethical considerations.
data.annotation: Annotated for quality based on the QUS framework and implications of ethical principles.

methodology.calculation: Quality assessed according to the criteria in the Quality User Stories (QUS) framework.
methodology.interpretation: User stories are interpreted as high-quality if they meet the established criteria without ambiguity and conflict.
methodology.baseline_results: Initial comparisons against prior work using GPT-4 indicated improvements across various metrics.
methodology.validation: Inter-annotator agreement calculated using Cohenâ€™s Kappa Coefficient yielded strong agreement on quality attributes.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: No personally identifiable information was used, and user stories focus on stakeholder roles.
